Class: lineChart

dc. lineChart

new lineChart(parent, chartGroup)

Concrete line/area chart implementation.

Examples:

  • Nasdaq 100 Index
  • Canadian City Crime Stats
Parameters:
Name Type Argument Description
parent String | node | d3.selection | dc.compositeChart

Any valid
d3 single selector
specifying a dom block element such as a div; or a dom element or d3 selection. If the line
chart is a sub-chart in a Composite Chart then pass in the parent
composite chart instance instead.
chartGroup String <optional>

The name of the chart group this chart instance should be placed in.
Interaction with a chart will only trigger events and redraws within the chart's group.
Mixes In:
  • dc.stackMixin
  • dc.coordinateGridMixin
Source:
  • line-chart.js, line 1
Returns:
Type
dc.lineChart
Example
// create a line chart under #chart-container1 element using the default global chart group
var chart1 = dc.lineChart('#chart-container1');
// create a line chart under #chart-container2 element using chart group A
var chart2 = dc.lineChart('#chart-container2', 'chartGroupA');
// create a sub-chart under a composite parent chart
var chart3 = dc.lineChart(compositeChart);

Methods

dashStyle(dashStyle)

Set the line's d3 dashstyle. This value becomes the 'stroke-dasharray' of line. Defaults to empty
array (solid line).

Parameters:
Name Type Argument Default Description
dashStyle Array.<Number> <optional>
 []
Source:
  • line-chart.js, line 149
See:
  • stroke-dasharray
Returns:
  • Type
    Array.<Number>
  • Type
    dc.lineChart
Example
// create a Dash Dot Dot Dot
chart.dashStyle([3,1,1,1]);

defined(defined)

Gets or sets a function that will determine discontinuities in the line which should be
skipped: the path will be broken into separate subpaths if some points are undefined.
This function is passed to
d3.svg.line.defined

Note: crossfilter will sometimes coerce nulls to 0, so you may need to carefully write
custom reduce functions to get this to work, depending on your data. See
https://github.com/dc-js/dc.js/issues/615#issuecomment-49089248

Parameters:
Name Type Argument Description
defined function <optional>
Source:
  • line-chart.js, line 124
See:
  • d3.svg.line.defined
Returns:
  • Type
    function
  • Type
    dc.lineChart

dotRadius(dotRadius)

Get or set the radius (in px) for dots displayed on the data points.

dotRadius Number <optional>
 5

    dc.lineChart

interpolate(interpolate)

Gets or sets the interpolator to use for lines drawn, by string name, allowing e.g. step
functions, splines, and cubic interpolation. This is passed to
d3.svg.line.interpolate and
d3.svg.area.interpolate,
where you can find a complete list of valid arguments

Parameters:
Name Type Argument Default Description
interpolate String <optional>
 'linear'
Source:
  • line-chart.js, line 79
See:
  • d3.svg.line.interpolate
  • d3.svg.area.interpolate
Returns:
  • Type
    String
  • Type
    dc.lineChart

renderArea(renderArea)

Get or set render area flag. If the flag is set to true then the chart will render the area
beneath each line and the line chart effectively becomes an area chart.

Parameters:
Name Type Argument Default Description
renderArea Boolean <optional>
 false
Source:
  • line-chart.js, line 171
Returns:
  • Type
    Boolean
  • Type
    dc.lineChart

renderDataPoints(options)

Always show individual dots for each datapoint.
If options is falsy, it disables data point rendering.

If no options are provided, the current options values are instead returned.

Parameters:
Name Type Argument Default Description
options Object <optional>
 {fillOpacity: 0.8, strokeOpacity: 0.8, radius: 2}
Source:
  • line-chart.js, line 435
Returns:
  • Type
    Object
  • Type
    dc.lineChart
Example
chart.renderDataPoints({radius: 2, fillOpacity: 0.8, strokeOpacity: 0.8})

tension(tension)

Gets or sets the tension to use for lines drawn, in the range 0 to 1.
This parameter further customizes the interpolation behavior. It is passed to
d3.svg.line.tension and
d3.svg.area.tension.

Parameters:
Name Type Argument Default Description
tension Number <optional>
 0.7
Source:
  • line-chart.js, line 102
See:
  • d3.svg.line.interpolate
  • d3.svg.area.interpolate
Returns:
  • Type
    Number
  • Type
    dc.lineChart

xyTipsOn(xyTipsOn)

Turn on/off the mouseover behavior of an individual data point which renders a circle and x/y axis
dashed lines back to each respective axis. This is ignored if the chart
brush is on

Parameters:
Name Type Argument Default Description
xyTipsOn Boolean <optional>
 false
